newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan auctions bonds worth 600 mln rupees.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan auctions bonds worth 600 mln rupees.

text.p: The State Bank of Pakistan said it had auctioned six-month maturity short-term federal bonds worth 600 million rupees in an open market operation on Wednesday.
It said bids worth 600 million rupees were accepted for the outright sale of the bonds at a maximum cut off of 16.75 percent a year.
In the previous auction held on February 6, the central bank had accepted bids worth 50 million rupees for outright sale of the bonds at a maximum cut-off of 16.75 percent.
